Package fr.rphstudio.chess.interf

Interface IChess

All Known Implementing Classes:
ChessModel2
public interface IChess
Interface used for Oriented-Object Programmming courses. The goal is to create a class (at least one ^^) that implements this interface, in order to simulate the chess game rules. /!\ DO NOT MODIFY THIS INTERFACE /!\

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Interface Description
    static class  IChess.ChessColor
    Enum used for chess piece colors.
    static class  IChess.ChessKingState
    Enum used for chess King piece status.
    static class  IChess.ChessPosition
    Class used for chess piece positions.
    static class  IChess.ChessType
    Enum used for chess piece types.

  • Method Details

    • reinit

      void reinit()
      Creates a new chess game. This methods must set all the piece positions on the board according to interface constants.

    • getPieceType

      IChess.ChessType getPieceType​(IChess.ChessPosition p) throws EmptyCellException, OutOfBoardException
      Gets the type of a piece at the given position on the board.
      Parameters:
      p - x/y position on the board where we want to get the piece type.
      Returns:
      the piece type at the requested position. Values are taken from ChessType.
      Throws:
      EmptyCellException - when the targeted cell contains no piece.
      OutOfBoardException - when the position is outside the chess board.

    • getPieceColor

      IChess.ChessColor getPieceColor​(IChess.ChessPosition p) throws EmptyCellException, OutOfBoardException
      Gets the color of a piece at the given position on the board.
      Parameters:
      p - x/y position on the board where we want to get the piece color.
      Returns:
      the piece color at the requested position. Values are taken from ChessColor.
      Throws:
      EmptyCellException - when the targeted cell contains no piece.
      OutOfBoardException - when the position is outside the chess board.

    • getNbRemainingPieces

      int getNbRemainingPieces​(IChess.ChessColor color)
      Count the remaining pieces on the board for a specific color.
      Parameters:
      color - the requested color of the pieces to count.
      Returns:
      count of remaining pieces.

    • getPieceMoves

      java.util.List<IChess.ChessPosition> getPieceMoves​(IChess.ChessPosition p)
      Gets the list of possible moves for a piece on the board. This is up to this method to ensure the moves are possible or not for each piece on the board. This list may be empty because either there is no possible move or because the requested position is empty or outside the board.
      Parameters:
      p - requested piece position.
      Returns:
      the list of possible moves for the requested piece position. The returned list reference must not be null.

    • movePiece

      void movePiece​(IChess.ChessPosition p0, IChess.ChessPosition p1)
      Moves a piece from a position to another. This method does not check if the move is possible or not. We assume the destinaton position has been taken from getPieceMoves returned list, so it is always valid.
      Parameters:
      p0 - source position on the board.
      p1 - destination position on the board.

    • getKingState

      IChess.ChessKingState getKingState​(IChess.ChessColor color)
      Gets the king status for the requested color. It is not up to this method to check if the game is over. This method just returns if the king is safe or not, depending on opponent piece positions.
      Parameters:
      color - the requested king color.
      Returns:
      the king status, either ChessKingState.KING_SAFE or ChessKingState.KING_SAFE.

    • getRemovedPieces

      java.util.List<IChess.ChessType> getRemovedPieces​(IChess.ChessColor color)
      Get the list of removed pieces from the beginning of the game.
      Parameters:
      color - color of the removed pieces
      Returns:
      list of removed chess piece types. The list is empty if no piece has been removed yet.

    • undoLastMove

      boolean undoLastMove()
      Cancel the very last move, setting the board with the state it was previously. Once this method is called, any other call will do nothing until we have moved one piece again. This method is designed to cancel the very last move, nothing less, nothing more. In other words, the implementation class must only keep one move in memory.
      Returns:
      a boolean value to indicate if a move has really been undone or not (very 1st move case).

    • getPlayerDuration

      long getPlayerDuration​(IChess.ChessColor color, boolean isPlaying)
      Returns the sum of each player turn durations. Each time a player turn begins, the time measurment begins too. When the player has moved its piece, the measurment stops for this player and starts again for the other player, and so on.
      Parameters:
      color - The color of the player from whom we want to get the current duration.
      isPlaying - Indicates if the player color is the one currently playing.
      Returns:
      total player turn duration in milliseconds.
